entry.title: RT Zane and Draas: Re Across fields such as engineering, sciences, marketing, media etc — the broader vision is that Developer DAO can serve as a con...
entry.summary: RT Zane and Draas Re Across fields such as engineering, sciences, marketing, media etc — the broader vision is that Developer DAO can serve as a conduit for other communities, projects, and ideas to spin out of. In his article, Luan refers to this as: “…creating a cycle of value across web3.”

entry.title: RT Zane and Draas: Re The thesis, as laid out in Luan’s article — is to restructure Developer DAO into 2 overarching layers: 1. Operational 2. DAO W...
entry.summary: RT Zane and Draas Re The thesis, as laid out in Luan’s article — is to restructure Developer DAO into 2 overarching layers: 1. Operational 2. DAO Within these layers, the DAO can operate across 3 primitives: • Pods (workgroups) • Hubs (core offerings) • SubDAOs (entities founded by members)

entry.title: RT Zane and Draas: Re In his article, Luan explains that months of observations revealed that only a small number of members want to be ‘contributors...
entry.summary: RT Zane and Draas Re In his article, Luan explains that months of observations revealed that only a small number of members want to be ‘contributors’. The majority would much rather use their membership to: • Connect with people • Join Hackathons 🏗️ • Learn • Fundraise 💰 • Find a job etc

entry.title: RT Zane and Draas: Re Developer DAO currently operates under a ‘Guild’ model, and it’s largely optimized for contributors. Outside of this, there a...
entry.summary: RT Zane and Draas Re Developer DAO currently operates under a ‘Guild’ model, and it’s largely optimized for contributors. Outside of this, there aren’t a lot of ways members can get involved. 𝗢𝗕𝗦𝗘𝗥𝗩𝗔𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡 Guilds conflate contributors and non-contributors — often leading to some confusion.

entry.title: RT Zane and Draas: Re A DAO is an acronym for ‘decentralized autonomous organization’. These entities have no direct governing body or office. Rathe...
entry.summary: RT Zane and Draas Re A DAO is an acronym for ‘decentralized autonomous organization’. These entities have no direct governing body or office. Rather, they operate on a system that empowers all members to make decisions. And while they share a common interest or goal—DAO members are not a monolith.
